jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2018, Causaly’s AI platform for enterprise-scale scientific research redefines the limits of human productivity. We give humans a powerful new way to find, visualize and interpret biomedical knowledge and automate critical research workflows, accelerating solutions for some of the greatest health challenges we face. 

We work with some of the world's largest biopharma companies and institutions on use cases spanning Drug Discovery, Safety and Competitive Intelligence. You can read more about how we accelerate knowledge acquisition and improve decision making in our blog posts here:  Blog - Causaly   

We are backed by top VCs including ICONIQ, Index Ventures, Pentech and Marathon.  

We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer to work on our API and business services. You will be responsible for designing and building scalable, reliable, and maintainable web applications. You will collaborate with our product and research teams to build and ship new features, contributing to all aspects of the development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to deployment and monitoring.

What we're looking for

  • 4+ years work experience with back-end applications

  • Solid understanding of Javascript

  • Familiarity with Node.js

  • Experience with TypeScript

  • Good knowledge of web architecture (URIs, HTTP, Caching, etc)

  • Proficiency in Git version control

  • Familiarity with UNIX terminal

  • Excellent knowledge of English language (verbal and written)

  • Solid understanding of relational databases

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working with Knowledge Graphs and graph databases, such as Neo4J

  • Experience working with Full-Text search databases, such as ElasticSearch

  • Good understanding of GraphQL

  • Experience working with Docker

  • Experience working with a functional programming language

  • Experience working with AWS or Google Cloud

Our Technology Stack

The list below is indicative and not exhaustive of the technologies we use at Causaly.

  • Node.js

  • Typescript

  • Git

  • ElasticSearch

  • Neo4J

  • RxJS

  • React

  • Webpack

Benefits

💰 Competitive compensation package   

🩺 Private medical insurance  

🤓 Personal development budget  

🧘 Individual wellbeing budget  

🎫 Monthly meal vouchers 

🤒 Enhanced sick leave (5 days on top of statutory) 

☎️ 24/7 access to Confidential Counselling service 

🥳 Your birthday off!

🚀 Potential to have real impact and accelerated career growth as a member of an international team that's building a transformative AI product. 

We are on a mission to accelerate scientific breakthroughs for ALL humankind, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and fairly consider qualified candidates without regard to race, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity, genetics, age, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, domestic / family status, veteran status or any other difference.

jobs.title: Strategic Client Partner, USA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2018, Causaly’s AI platform for enterprise-scale scientific research redefines the limits of human productivity. We give humans a powerful new way to find, visualize and interpret biomedical knowledge and automate critical research workflows, accelerating solutions for some of the greatest health challenges we face. 

We work with some of the world's largest biopharma companies and institutions on use cases spanning Drug Discovery, Safety and Competitive Intelligence. You can read more about how we accelerate knowledge acquisition and improve decision making in our blog posts here:  Blog - Causaly   

We are backed by top VCs including ICONIQ, Index Ventures, Pentech and Marathon.  

In this role, you will be a key contributor to Causaly’s revenue growth while inspiring change as a market game-changer. Reporting directly to our COO you will work cross-functionally to build customer value and drive new business. You will have global ownership of the full lifecycle of a portfolio of top 50 global pharma enterprise customers. You will be pivotal to understand our client’s strategy, relate to the executive level and navigate our resources and capabilities to the “best fit”.  

What you will do: 

  • Become a trusted advisor in the AI Pharma sector to existing and target Causaly clients 

  • Leverage your existing industry network to open early discussions and get critical customer insights 

  • Establish relationships at senior call points in Top Pharma and work to develop and qualify interest in use cases and business challenges that Causaly can address 

  • Drive new business for Causaly Cloud platform solution, selling into the existing client base and prospective new clients across North America, focused on the Top 30 clients. 

  • Strategically understand the needs, limits, must haves, and key landmines in the accounts and guide the go to market teams in execution 

  • Develop an understanding of assigned clients’ strategic goals, decision-making structure, key influencers, and other objectives while mapping Causaly impact through both today’s offerings and tomorrow’s potential 

  • Liaise with Product to refine Product Market Messaging and contribute customer and market feedback about future business opportunities and current product experience.   

  • Become a champion for the Causaly Platform with ability to deeply discuss the value across any given product in the solution. 

  • Strategically orchestrate resources both internally and externally throughout the sales process 

  • Accurately communicate account status to executive Causaly management 

What you need to succeed: 

  • Experience in engaging to scientific, technical and economic buyers and decision-makers up to C-Suite in global 30 Pharma 

  • Consultative selling skills (questioning, listening, handling call dynamics, managing objections, closing for next steps) 

  • Leadership experience (VP, SVP) and / or selling experience into Big Pharma & Biotech space (e.g. as a Partner of a strategy consulting firm) 

  • The ability to work in partnership with Strategic Account Executives to develop opportunities and sell the value of the Causaly Cloud platform 

  • Make sure that our clients and prospects understand and perceive the full value of our products while acting as a trusted voice in articulating Causaly positioning 

  • Experience leading strategic, long-term sales cycles within the biopharma sector 

  • Strong presenter, both in person and virtually 

Benefits

💰 Competitive compensation package

🤓 Personal development budget  

🧘 Individual wellbeing budget  

🥳 Your birthday off! 

♾️ Unlimited time off 

🧑‍🍼 12 weeks paid parental leave (after 6 months) 

 

🚀 Potential to have real impact and accelerated career growth as a member of an international team that's building a transformative AI product. 

We are on a mission to accelerate scientific breakthroughs for ALL humankind, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and fairly consider qualified candidates without regard to race, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity, genetics, age, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, domestic / family status, veteran status or any other difference.

jobs.title: Product Manager - Scientist Workflows (Agentic AI)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2018, Causaly’s AI platform for enterprise-scale scientific research redefines the limits of human productivity. We give humans a powerful new way to find, visualize and interpret biomedical knowledge and automate critical research workflows, accelerating solutions for some of the greatest health challenges we face. 

We work with some of the world's largest biopharma companies and institutions on use cases spanning Drug Discovery, Safety and Competitive Intelligence. You can read more about how we accelerate knowledge acquisition and improve decision making in our blog posts here:  Blog - Causaly   

We are backed by top VCs including ICONIQ, Index Ventures, Pentech and Marathon.  

About the role:

We are seeking a Product Manager to help shape how scientists use AI to do their work. This role will focus on building experiences that allow researchers to create, refine, and share their work products with the support of Agentic AI.

You will work closely with engineering, design, and customer-facing teams to develop solutions that enhance scientific workflows, drive engagement, and expand the impact of our platform. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to the evolution of our offering as we define new ways for scientists to collaborate with AI and produce high-quality artefacts of their work.

Requirements

What you’ll be doing:

  • Contribute to product strategy and roadmap for AI-powered scientific workflows.

  • Define product requirements and priorities, working with engineering and design to deliver at pace and quality.

  • Partner with cross-functional teams, including Customer Success, Science and Product Marketing, to deliver solutions that scientists adopt and value.

  • Develop a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors, especially how scientists create, share, and collaborate on work products, and use insights to inform decisions.

  • Monitor product performance, usage, and feedback to inform decisions and iterations.

  • Stay informed on market trends, competitor approaches, and emerging opportunities in AI-powered productivity.

What we’re looking for:

  • You will have 3-5 years' experience in product management (ideally B2B SaaS).

  • Experience in Life Sciences/BioTech/BioPharma (this is a plus but not required).

  • You have familiarity with AI / data products and exposure to LLM-powered tools.

  • You enjoy working in complex problem spaces – solving both technical problems and product questions, balancing business, technical and user requirements.

  • You have strong collaboration skills, working effectively with cross-functional teams.

  • You have an analytical and data-driven mindset, using insights to guide product decisions.

  • You are a clear and confident communicator across a wide range of stakeholders.

What we’d love to see:

  • Curiosity about scientific research processes and enthusiasm for enabling them with AI.

  • Experience working on products that shape user workflows or outputs.

  • A learning mindset and passion for solving complex problems in new ways.

Benefits UK

💰 Competitive compensation package

🩺 Private medical insurance

🦷 Private dental insurance

📔 Life insurance (4 x salary)

🤓 Personal development budget

🧘 Individual wellbeing budget

🌴 25 days holiday plus bank holidays

🥳 Your birthday off!

🚀 Potential to have real impact and accelerated career growth as a member of an international team that's building a transformative AI product.

We are on a mission to accelerate scientific breakthroughs for ALL humankind, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and fairly consider qualified candidates without regard to race, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity, genetics, age, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, domestic / family status, veteran status or any other difference.

jobs.title: Senior AI Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2018, Causaly’s AI platform for enterprise-scale scientific research redefines the limits of human productivity. We give humans a powerful new way to find, visualize and interpret biomedical knowledge and automate critical research workflows, accelerating solutions for some of the greatest health challenges we face. 

We work with some of the world's largest biopharma companies and institutions on use cases spanning Drug Discovery, Safety and Competitive Intelligence. You can read more about how we accelerate knowledge acquisition and improve decision making in our blog posts here:  Blog - Causaly   

We are backed by top VCs including ICONIQ, Index Ventures, Pentech and Marathon.  

About the team

We’re hiring AI engineers to help us transform research outcomes in biomedical sciences. We utilise generative AI and agents to help scientists find novel connections and insights from biomedical literature and datasets.

Delivering a faster research experience is not just a matter of picking the latest LLM model. Getting accurate, scientifically relevant, trustworthy and meaningful results relies on building trust with our users that comes from integrating proper levels of guardrails, biomedical curation, consistent update cycles and robust deployment practices that make our platform a one-stop shop for a researcher’s needs.

We’re looking for AI engineers who will champion this cause and help us apply AI to transform the way biomedical professionals carry out their research and day-to-day exploration.

What you’ll be doing

· Design and implement ML/AI solutions end-to-end, from the idea and data exploration phase to deployment and monitoring, balancing cutting-edge techniques with pragmatism to deliver measurable impact.

· Apply strong software engineering principles, such as modularity, testing, code reviews, CI/CD and observability, to ensure AI systems are reliable, maintainable, production-ready and can be readily adapted to future developments.

· Choose the right approach for the problem at hand, evaluating classical ML and NLP techniques, LLM-based solutions, and agentic solutions to balance trade-offs between speed, cost, complexity, interpretability, and performance.

· Collaborate closely with product, design, and other engineering teams to scope work, align on success metrics, and incrementally ship improvements in user-facing features powered by AI.

· Document system architectures and decision rationale early and clearly, enabling alignment across teams and accelerating onboarding and iteration.

· Champion model and data quality, including dataset versioning, robust evaluation, fairness/bias assessment, and real-world performance tracking.

· Mentor junior AI engineers and cross-functional teammates, sharing best practices in modelling, coding, maintaining and integrating product features, and helping grow a high-trust, high-performance team culture.

· Stay up-to-date with emerging research and tools, distilling key insights and bringing back relevant innovations to elevate team capabilities and product opportunities.

· Contribute to a culture of knowledge sharing, through company-wide Slack channels, Show and Tell presentations and technical deep-dives.

What experience you’ll need to be successful

· A master's degree or above in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.

· 5+ years of experience building AI/ML systems in production environments, including ownership of key lifecycle stages: data collection, modeling, evaluation, deployment, and monitoring.

· Proficiency in Python and modern ML and agentic frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or LangChain, with experience packaging models into APIs or integrating them into applications.

· A solid understanding of LLMs for natural language processing applications, including topics such as embeddings, prompt engineering and fine-tuning.

· Strong software engineering foundations such as version control, unit/integration testing, CI/CD, containerization plus a mindset of building for reliability and scale.

· Experience working in product-focused teams, collaborating with designers, engineers, and PMs, to scope and ship AI features iteratively

· Ability to reason about system behavior end-to-end, including model performance, latency, and observability, and how these impact user experience.

· Clear, structured communicator, comfortable documenting and defending architectural decisions and engaging in thoughtful technical debate.

Not required, but it’s a plus if you also have:

· Experience with MLOps/LLMOps frameworks and best practices

· A PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.

· A background or work experience in life-sciences, health-tech, or other data-intensive domains

Benefits

💰 Competitive compensation package   

🩺 Private medical & dental insurance  

📔 Life insurance (4 x salary)   

🤓 Personal development budget  

🧘 Individual wellbeing budget  

🌴 25 days holiday plus bank holidays  

🥳 Your birthday off! 

🚀 Potential to have real impact and accelerated career growth as a member of an international team that's building a transformative AI product. 

We are on a mission to accelerate scientific breakthroughs for ALL humankind, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and fairly consider qualified candidates without regard to race, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity, genetics, age, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, domestic / family status, veteran status or any other difference.

jobs.title: Strategic Client Associate, EMEA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2018, Causaly’s AI platform for enterprise-scale scientific research redefines the limits of human productivity. We give humans a powerful new way to find, visualize and interpret biomedical knowledge and automate critical research workflows, accelerating solutions for some of the greatest health challenges we face. 

We work with some of the world's largest biopharma companies and institutions on use cases spanning Drug Discovery, Safety and Competitive Intelligence. You can read more about how we accelerate knowledge acquisition and improve decision making in our blog posts here:  Blog - Causaly   

We are backed by top VCs including ICONIQ, Index Ventures, Pentech and Marathon.  

In this role, you will be a key contributor to Causaly’s revenue growth while inspiring change as a market game-changer. Reporting directly to one of our Strategic Client Partners (SCP) you will work cross-functionally to build customer value and drive new business. You will have global ownership of the full lifecycle of a portfolio of top-50 global pharma enterprise customers. You will be pivotal in understanding our clients’ strategy, engaging at the executive level, and aligning Causaly’s resources and capabilities to achieve the “best fit.”

The Opportunity:

As we expand our partnerships, we are looking for a dynamic Strategic Client Associate to ensure our clients not only adopt and use Causaly but derive measurable value from it.

This is a hands-on, delivery-focused role where you will combine data-driven account management with strategic problem solving. You will monitor account health, identify opportunities, and execute initiatives that foster adoption, build communities of users, and strengthen engagement through events and workshops.

You will be embedded in the action, helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. By working directly with clients and alongside colleagues across Causaly, you will generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions that make a lasting difference in Life Sciences R&D.

What You’ll Do:

Drive Adoption and Value

  • Understand client’s strategy and develop hypothesis driven approaches on how to drive adoption and growth in the account

  • Take a data-driven approach to account management, tracking and reporting on account health.

  • Proactively identify challenges and opportunities for growth, such as Scientific Liaison led professional services, user community initiatives, or targeted engagement events.

  • Develop and execute plans to increase usage and adoption, ensuring clients realise tangible value.

  • Build / collaborate on building business case and projection models for the accounts

Problem Solving and Workstream Leadership

  • Take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face.

  • Use research, data analysis, interviews, and workshops to uncover root causes and generate fresh solutions.

  • Collaborate with clients to refine strategies and implement transformations that endure beyond our direct involvement.

Quarterly Planning and Execution

  • Define quarterly objectives and deliverables in alignment with the Strategic Client Partner (SCP).

  • Incorporate input from wider internal stakeholders (e.g. Scientific Liaison, Senior Strategic Consultant) to shape realistic and impactful objectives.

  • Deliver agreed outputs by coordinating team bandwidth and cross-functional support.

Workflow Management

  • Maintain a structured and up-to-date backlog of tasks (e.g. Asana).

  • Assign clear task owners and due dates, ensuring visibility and accountability.

  • Lead weekly working sessions to monitor progress, resolve bottlenecks, and reallocate resources.

Communication and Reporting

  • Share weekly updates in the account Slack channel covering outcomes, next week’s deliverables, and specific support required.

  • Provide structured syntheses of client calls, including purpose, attendees, key topics, action items, and next steps.

  • Present monthly account health status reports showing engagement and client value over time against the initiatives run and the upcoming planned initiatives along with how these will attain our account goals.

Client Engagement Preparation

  • Align Quarterly Business Review (QBR) deliverables with the SCP and lead creation of high-quality client ready materials.

  • Proactively schedule and manage internal content reviews (e.g. agendas, kick-off decks, QBRs).

  • Keep the Causaly leadership fully informed of all upcoming client interactions, planned objectives for those interactions and structure outcomes oriented next steps that derive from them.

What We’re Looking For:

  • 3–5 years of experience in client facing program, project, or consultative roles, ideally in life sciences or SaaS/AI sectors.

  • Proven ability to drive platform user adoption and value realisation, with experience monitoring account health and translating insights into action.

  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to use data to tell a client’s story, uncover challenges, and shape opportunities.

  • Track record of leading structured delivery processes across teams and functions.

  • A consultative, hypothesis driven problem solving mindset with the ability to design and execute solutions that deliver lasting impact.

  • Excellent communication skills, capable of synthesising complex discussions into clear, actionable summaries.

  • Excellent Microsoft Office Suite skills (Advanced Excel and Power point) and proficient user of GenAI products (ChatGPT, Perplexity)

  • Motivation to deliver measurable outcomes for clients and thrive in a fast paced, high growth environment.

  • Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

Benefits UK:

💰 Competitive compensation package

🩺 Private medical insurance

🦷 Private dental insurance

📔 Life insurance (4 x salary)

💸Income protection insurance

🤓 Personal development budget

🧘 Individual wellbeing budget

🌴 25 days holiday plus bank holidays

🥳 Your birthday off!

🚀 Potential to have real impact and accelerated career growth as a member of an international team that's building a transformative AI product.

You will be embedded in the action, helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. By working directly with clients and alongside colleagues across Causaly, you will generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions that make a lasting difference in Life Sciences R&D.

What You’ll Do:

Drive Adoption and Value

 - Understand client’s strategy and develop hypothesis driven approaches on how to drive adoption and growth in the account

 - Take a data-driven approach to account management, tracking and reporting on account health.

 - Proactively identify challenges and opportunities for growth, such as Scientific Liaison led professional services, user community initiatives, or targeted engagement events.

 - Develop and execute plans to increase usage and adoption, ensuring clients realise tangible value.

 - Build / collaborate on building business case and projection models for the accounts

Problem Solving and Workstream Leadership

 - Take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face.

 - Use research, data analysis, interviews, and workshops to uncover root causes and generate fresh solutions.

 - Collaborate with clients to refine strategies and implement transformations that endure beyond our direct involvement.

Quarterly Planning and Execution

 - Define quarterly objectives and deliverables in alignment with the Strategic Client Partner (SCP).

 - Incorporate input from wider internal stakeholders (e.g. Scientific Liaison, Senior Strategic Consultant) to shape realistic and impactful objectives.

 - Deliver agreed outputs by coordinating team bandwidth and cross-functional support.

Workflow Management

 - Maintain a structured and up-to-date backlog of tasks (e.g. Asana).

 - Assign clear task owners and due dates, ensuring visibility and accountability.

 - Lead weekly working sessions to monitor progress, resolve bottlenecks, and reallocate resources.

Communication and Reporting

 - Share weekly updates in the account Slack channel covering outcomes, next week’s deliverables, and specific support required.

 - Provide structured syntheses of client calls, including purpose, attendees, key topics, action items, and next steps.

 - Present monthly account health status reports showing engagement and client value over time against the initiatives run and the upcoming planned initiatives along with how these will attain our account goals.
   
   Client Engagement Preparation

 - Align Quarterly Business Review (QBR) deliverables with the SCP and lead creation of high-quality client ready materials.

 - Proactively schedule and manage internal content reviews (e.g. agendas, kick-off decks, QBRs).

 - Keep the Causaly leadership fully informed of all upcoming client interactions, planned objectives for those interactions and structure outcomes oriented next steps that derive from them.

What We’re Looking For:

 - 3–5 years of experience in client facing program, project, or consultative roles, ideally in life sciences or SaaS/AI sectors.

 - Proven ability to drive platform user adoption and value realisation, with experience monitoring account health and translating insights into action.

 - Strong analytical skills, with the ability to use data to tell a client’s story, uncover challenges, and shape opportunities.

 - Track record of leading structured delivery processes across teams and functions.

 - A consultative, hypothesis driven problem solving mindset with the ability to design and execute solutions that deliver lasting impact.

 - Excellent communication skills, capable of synthesising complex discussions into clear, actionable summaries.

 - Excellent Microsoft Office Suite skills (Advanced Excel and Power point) and proficient user of GenAI products (ChatGPT, Perplexity)

 - Motivation to deliver measurable outcomes for clients and thrive in a fast paced, high growth environment.

 - Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

Benefits

💰 Competitive compensation package

🤓 Personal development budget

🧘 Individual wellbeing budget

🥳 Your birthday off!

♾️ Unlimited time off

🧑‍🍼 12 weeks paid parental leave (after 6 months)

🚀 Potential to have real impact and accelerated career growth as a member of an international team that’s building a transformative AI product.

We are on a mission to accelerate scientific breakthroughs for ALL humankind, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and fairly consider qualified candidates without regard to race, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity, genetics, age, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, domestic / family status, veteran status or any other difference.

jobs.title: Scientific Solutions Consultant
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2018, Causaly’s AI platform for enterprise-scale scientific research redefines the limits of human productivity. We give humans a powerful new way to find, visualize and interpret biomedical knowledge and automate critical research workflows, accelerating solutions for some of the greatest health challenges we face. 

We work with some of the world's largest biopharma companies and institutions on use cases spanning Drug Discovery, Safety and Competitive Intelligence. You can read more about how we accelerate knowledge acquisition and improve decision making in our blog posts here:  Blog - Causaly   

We are backed by top VCs including ICONIQ, Index Ventures, Pentech and Marathon.  

About the role:

At Causaly, we’re building a category-defining platform that transforms how researchers think, discover, and make decisions in biomedicine. We’re looking for a Solutions Consultant, Global Life Sciences to partner with Account Executives throughout the customer journey - helping prospective clients understand how Causaly’s technology can accelerate their research and deliver measurable value. As a core member of our Go-To-Market team, you’ll play a pivotal role in driving growth by providing scientific and technical expertise across all stages of the sales cycle - from first engagement to close. Working alongside our commercial team, you’ll design and showcase tailored solutions, deliver compelling demonstrations, and ensure each interaction reflects the power and credibility of Causaly’s product.

What you’ll be doing:

As part of Causaly’s Go-To-Market team, you’ll serve as both a scientific partner and a Causaly product expert - bridging cutting-edge science with commercial strategy. You’ll develop a deep understanding of our platform’s capabilities, becoming a go-to specialist for demonstrating how Causaly transforms research workflows and decision-making. You’ll work closely with prospective and existing customers to uncover their scientific challenges, design tailored solutions, and showcase how Causaly can accelerate discovery, de-risk projects, and deliver measurable value. As a trusted expert, you’ll articulate the scientific, operational, and business impact of our technology with authority and clarity, guiding customers from first engagement through successful adoption.

You will:

  • Engage at all stages of the sales process, from discovery to close, shaping tailored solutions that fit each customer’s research needs.

  • Deliver scientifically grounded product demonstrations that bring Causaly’s capabilities to life.

  • Translate complex scientific and technical concepts into clear, compelling insights that resonate with R&D, Digital, and Business stakeholders - from bench scientists to senior leadership.

  • Support customers as they design and evolve their AI strategy and data ecosystem, positioning Causaly as a core enabler of evidence-based decision making.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Product, and Customer Success teams to accelerate adoption, ensure scientific credibility, and maximize customer value.

  • Represent Causaly at industry events, conferences, and client meetings.

What we’re looking for:

  • PhD in Biomedical or Life Sciences (e.g., Biology, Pharmacology, Neuroscience, or related field).

  • Strong ability to communicate complex ideas clearly, both verbally and in writing.

  • Experience and confidence delivering scientific presentations to diverse audiences.

  • Understanding of drug discovery and development processes and the tools commonly used in R&D.

  • Curiosity about how AI and data technologies are transforming research and decision-making in life sciences.

  • Ability to build credibility and trust with scientific and technical stakeholders.

  • A commercial and strategic mindset - comfortable thinking beyond the lab to understand customer priorities and business impact.

Why join Causaly:

At Causaly, you’ll help shape how the world’s leading pharma and biotech companies discover knowledge and make data-driven decisions. You’ll gain exposure to cutting-edge AI technology, collaborate with brilliant scientists and innovators, and develop unique commercial and strategic skills that bridge science and business. This role is ideal for a scientist who loves connecting ideas, people, and technology and wants to leverage their PhD beyond the bench to drive real-world impact.

Benefits

💰 Competitive compensation package

🤓 Personal development budget

🧘 Individual wellbeing budget

🥳 Your birthday off!

♾️ Unlimited time off

🧑‍🍼 12 weeks paid parental leave (after 6 months)

🚀 Potential to have real impact and accelerated career growth as a member of an international team that’s building a transformative AI product.

We are on a mission to accelerate scientific breakthroughs for ALL humankind, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and fairly consider qualified candidates without regard to race, ethnic or national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity, genetics, age, religion or belief, marital/civil partnership status, domestic / family status, veteran status or any other difference.
